title: Another Mass. college has Harvard and MIT beat in WSJ’s new ranking
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Education With emphasis on financial preparation, Babson College ranked first in the state and second in the country.
Babson College campus.

Lane Turner/The Boston Globe While Harvard and MIT are no stranger to the tops of college ranking lists, another Massachusetts college ranked first in the state on The Wall Street Journal’s new list of best colleges in America.

title: Methuen shuts down second suspected human trafficking front
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime “Methuen has zero tolerance for those who profit from human suffering in our city,” Mayor D.
J.
Beauregard said.

title: Do you think Provincetown is losing its charm?
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Tell Us The town's unique inns — a staple for decades — are in decline.
Commercial Street in Provincetown.

Barry Chin/Globe Staff By Kristi Palma September 30, 2025 | 12:16 PM 1 minute to read Provincetown, a seaside town on the northern tip of Cape Cod well known for its restaurants, art galleries, and LGBTQ community, may be losing its nostalgic charm, according to an article in The Boston Globe.

title: As ICE recruits local police, its crackdown in Mass. continues
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News ICE is specifically trying to recruit local police who may be upset with policies that limit their involvement in immigration enforcement.
Homeland Security officers walk into the ICE Detention Center in Burlington.
Jessica Rinaldi / The Boston Globe, File ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Airline to cut 61 jobs at Logan Airport
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business Piedmont Airlines, a subsidiary of American Airlines Group, says it will end its vendor services in Boston this November.
American Airlines passenger jets prepare for departure, near a terminal at Boston Logan International Airport.

(AP Photo/Steven Senne, File) Piedmont Airlines, a subsidiary of American Airlines Group, will cut 61 jobs at Boston Logan International Airport in November as it ends its ground handling services there.

title: Man arrested in R.I. after allegedly kidnapping elderly woman from outside Mass. restaurant
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The 36-year-old Johnston, Rhode Island, man has pleaded not guilty to five felony charges, including indecent assault and battery.
Michael J.
Guerrero.

title: Driver dead, 3 juveniles injured in I-195 crash
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News State Police believe the driver suffered a medical emergency.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A single-car crash in Rehoboth left the driver dead and three juvenile passengers injured on Monday morning.

title: ‘The Yankees are home and have the better team’: Here are Red Sox-Yankees predictions from MLB experts
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "The Yankees simply have too much firepower, and Judge is bound to finally deliver in the postseason.
" Aaron Judge takes batting practice at Yankee Stadium on Monday prior to wild-card series vs.
Red Sox.
